name: Neriak, City of Hate
notes: The legendary home of the dark elves. A city rich with history and brutality, Neriak can be a deadly place to any who cross the dark elves that live there. Masters of both martial and magical combat, the Teir'Dal continue their research into the dark arts they are known and feared for.

npcs.name: Abraxas
utterances: Do not trifle with me, mortal.
Fool, I could eat you.

npcs.name: Acquisitions Expert Kyri Velkyn
utterances: What's mine is mine; what's yours is negotiable.

npcs.name: Adintrin Du'Voy
utterances: Better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
May the dark bless your travels.
Watch all about, warily, and Innoruuk may give you the gift of continued life.

npcs.name: Akorra J'Trezin
utterances: Feh.  Too much to do.

npcs.name: Alabreena De'Auvrylyl
utterances: Ahh... Whoa!
Oooo!

npcs.name: Alakomph J'Xetar
utterances: Perhaps, others need your help.

npcs.name: Alaundra Z'Zyep
utterances: Oooo!
Oooooo!

npcs.name: Alaunnolu D'Xaate
utterances: The craftsmanship of the Teir'Dal is truly amazing!
Oooh. How much do you cost?

npcs.name: Alaunquiri N'Hunep
utterances: What brings you to the Spires of Innoruuk, <player name>?

npcs.name: Alesandra D'Ryil
utterances: Mmmmmm ... You look just lickable. Come a little closer, let's see your neck.

npcs.name: Althrae T'Vivirr
utterances: Hatred of the Haeth'Un brings us closer to achieving that which the Creator, Innoruuk, has destined for us.

The faithless members of the Spurned should abandon any real hope of ever discovering the meaning of the Runes of Hate. Such matters are meant to be discovered by none other than Innoruuk's most devoted.

Though the Dead may be the ruling class in Neriak, they do not rule the children of Innoruuk. The Dark Father has returned to Norrath to guide the faithful and we disciples have been blessed with the task of delivering his unholy message.

npcs.name: Alyda Vlonniss
utterances: I hate this place.

npcs.name: Ambassador V'Nox
utterances: Greetings, stranger.  If you are interested in becoming a citizen of Neriak, speak to the Ambassador in your home city to arrange the paperwork, then return to me.

npcs.name: Anson D'Ryil
utterances: Would you care to join us? I'm sure you would have a good time. Hmm ... hhmm. hhmmmm!

npcs.name: Antryne T'Zirret
utterances: An angry Teir'Dal is fit to pray to our Father.
A trade not properly learned is an enemy.

npcs.name: an Arasai male
utterances: Our mother.

npcs.name: Argail the Vile
utterances: Hello!  Such a mischievous day, is it not?

npcs.name: an audience member
utterances: Praise Her Grotesque Glorifiousness!
A tale worthy of song, indeed!

npcs.name: Brizlay Do'Oussval
utterances: Yes, <player name>.  What brings you to our city of hate?

npcs.name: Chalolin D'Zeiryn
utterances: The Prophet has no choice in this matter. The Queen has spoken, and her word is law.
We will see about that.
I have no doubt we can handle the examination of the scroll. The Queen demands its immediate removal to the palace.

npcs.name: Chalthara V'Zeraep
utterances: Yes, what can I help you with?

Currently you are standing in the Fourth Gate of Neriak. Some call it the Royal District. More like a commoner's death trap if you ask me. Across that bridge there, lies Darklight Palace, home of Queen Cristanos, Neriak's current ruler. From her throne, she leads an army of necromancers and shadowknights who carry out her will unflinchingly. Unless you practice the dark arts like them, I suggest you avoid that place at all costs. Who knows what the Queen might do to you!

Me, oh, I'm nobody. Just a simple chandler named Chalthara. Chalthara the Chandler, they call me. A chandler is a candle-maker if you didn't already know that. Quite a profitable trade considering everyone here lives in a cave! Ha ha! Oh, excuse me; I just realized how ironic that statement was.

npcs.name: Chaszzyr Do'Rilyntar
utterances: Yes, <player name>.  What brings you to our city of hate?

npcs.name: City Registrar NVar
utterances: May the Dark Queen's blessing be with you.

npcs.name: Dalion D'Abth
utterances: The City of Neriak thanks you for your service.

npcs.name: Darvin Malkia
utterances: The magic of time is powerful.  To master it takes a lifetime.

npcs.name: Dead Eye Massassi
utterances: Keep your eye on the target. Now fire.
Slow your breathing. Focus. Let it fly.

npcs.name: Dilxena D'Xeep
utterances: I have nothing else to teach you for the moment.  Please return to me when you have earned enough experience to choose your specialty.

npcs.name: Dindrin Y'Rhineld
utterances: My work requires concentration.

npcs.name: Divton T'Szelyl
utterances: It's beautiful, isn't it?
It's teleporters like these that have revolutionized transportation here in Neriak and beyond.

Well, take this teleporter for example. Simple in its design, relatively speaking. A person steps within the ring and poof! Instantly the person is teleported to a duplicate teleporter located somewhere else within the city.
This teleporter exists as a testament of the Dark Bargainers' unquestionable devotion to Innoruuk and his children, the Teir'Dal.

In an effort to maximize the efficiency of our trade practices, we created several of these teleporters and placed them around the city. Doing so allowed goods and people to be easily transported across the expanse of the city in a short amount of time.

Now, it's no secret that the other houses harbor no real love for us. Undoubtedly they'll try to fill your head with propagandistic diatribes. I've personally heard accusations of monopolies, unfair business practices and other untruths. I'm here to tell you they are all wrong and the presence of these teleporters proves it!

Shortly after all the teleporters were put in place, we publicly decreed that all devoted followers of Innoruuk and their most trusted allies may freely use these teleporters to move about the city at no cost.
Well, as I said, all "devoted" followers may use these devices. You, my friend, need to demonstrate your devotion.
Of course! I'm glad you're beginning to see how things are done around here. Now, I could use your help with some murders and executions.

Oh dear, what I meant to say was mergers and acquisitions. You see, the Dark Bargainers' trade network extends all throughout Neriak and by nature we often buy and sell from vendors who are not necessarily members of our house.
Well, these transactions also give us the ability to observe our competitors. If someone is making too much money, we step in and purchase their businessâ€¦ at a competitive rate, of course.

Why none other than Innoruuk himself. Our motivations are not out of greed, but of devotion to the Dark Creator. In fact a large portion of our profits are donated to the Temple of Innoruuk. Besides, these vendors are little more than paltry commoners. Skittish cave rats personified.

Excellent, someone who wants to "get down to brass tacks." At least I think that's what the saying is. Here, take this stack of contracts. On top you'll find a list of people who will need to sign their respective contract thus relinquishing ownership of their business. You shouldn't have too much trouble procuring their signatures. Each owner is being well-compensated for the loss of their business.

npcs.name: Drill-Master Gratias
utterances: Attack low!
Parry!
Thrust!
Attention!
Attack high!

npcs.name: Driseyl V'Tazizin
utterances: A rogue believes everybody steals.
A lock is better than suspicion, wouldn't you say?

npcs.name: Drise Z'Torzin
utterances: You bother Drise further and the fish will greet you.

npcs.name: a D'Ryil vampire
utterances: Come closer and I'll give you a little peck on the cheek.
Snack time.

npcs.name: Durrysn B'Kiltar
utterances: How did you sneak in here?  No matter.  This is where you will meet your fate.

npcs.name: Eliha, Scion of the Dead
utterances: Summoning the lesser undead is a simple incantation. Observe.
Summoning the greater undead takes practice and concentration. Observe.
This is how you summon a first sphere construct of Hate. Eyes on me.
Constructs of Hate from the second sphere are more difficult to coerce into this plane. Observe.
Constructs of Hate from the third sphere are incredibly difficult to summon. Only the Queen and myself have mastered this feat.

npcs.name: Ensorcelled stone
utterances: There is nothing recorded upon me that is intended for you.

npcs.name: Erthzaer N'Qhaath
utterances: Look what strolled into the spider's web!
I will have vengeance!

npcs.name: Eruvin T`Kix
utterances: Ah, yes.  You must be <player name>.  Welcome to the fold.  As you see, not even death can stop the truth and power of Innoruuk's hate.
We will now continue with your discipleship.
There are more acts of penance and service in the name of The Prince of Hate that await you.  Those that you choose will test you and allow you to grow in his glory.

npcs.name: Ethedra R'Vinival
utterances: No time to chat now. There are bargains to be had.

npcs.name: Exporter Makarios
utterances: Time and money are wasting.

npcs.name: Faviln Cobbleblork
utterances: Oh, Jondy, you've really made a mess of things now! Fling zomping and kittens. Fling zomping and kittens?! That'll never work!

npcs.name: Felyndiira T'Taziund
utterances: There is little for you in the Library of K'Lorn.

npcs.name: Frascher D'Ryil
utterances: Watch your neck.

npcs.name: Gandol Deathwing
utterances: What? What is it?

I am in the studies of bonecasting... It is much like necromancy however it does not draw upon the arts of using the dead to do your bidding. This magic draws upon the energies left behind by the dead to focus power through the ethernere into very powerful spells!

Do you honestly think that such studies are cheap? I must keep up the funding in order to have fresh "specimens" in order to draw my power... I admit being a mercenary not only keeps up my funds but also allows me to research fascinating ways to create death and harness its power!

npcs.name: Gellochar J'Zsiate
utterances: This one's ours find your own.
You had your chance.
I hope you put your affairs in order.
I will have vengeance!

npcs.name: Goeyl Z'Vuear
utterances: Do not disrupt me from my duties.

npcs.name: Goor D'Arkund
utterances: What brings you to the hallowed halls of the Spires of Innoruuk?

npcs.name: Grandmaster Zyrythius
utterances: Come see me later, I may have some work for you once you're more skilled in your trade.

npcs.name: Haine Corbould
utterances: What brings you to the hallowed halls of the Spires of Innoruuk?

npcs.name: a House De'Tretlar slave
utterances: Too many guards.

npcs.name: a house imp
utterances: I busy, busy!
No catch me!
Hellos to you.
Me didn't do it!

npcs.name: a House X'Rzheduis slave
utterances: Run!  Leave this place while you can!

npcs.name: Hurze Do'Zaani
utterances: This teleporter seems to be malfunctioning... Odd.

npcs.name: Ilphtana V'Vaafin
utterances: When the spider webs unite they can tie up any Haeth'Un.
Ask me no questions and I'll tell you lies.
Better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.

npcs.name: Ilztrak J'Xyliath
utterances: The brainwashed rank and file who call themselves the Dreadguard are little more than flunkies for the Dead. I find it audacious that they be charged to hunt down the very Dragoons who fought tirelessly to establish this great empire!
Take heed of your words when speaking of the Queen. More than a few officers who mistakenly vocalized their discontent with her rule were never seen again.
The Darthiir endlessly conspire with humans of Qeynos in a futile attempt to stifle our efforts. Ha! I look forward to the day when ground beneath that accursed city opens up and swallows it whole.
How can anyone still call us a brotherhood? All the generals squabble amongst themselves, vying for the favor of our so-called Queen.

npcs.name: Importer Targin
utterances: Makarios handles all the business.

npcs.name: Innkeeper T'Vox
utterances: Hail to you too.

npcs.name: Jhultyrr D'Vethiurden
utterances: Yes? I must begin my training shortly, though I suppose I can answer a question for you.

You are standing in Seloxia Stronghold; home of the Indigo Brotherhood. Here you will find nothing less than the finest warriors in all of Neriak and quite possibly all of Norrath. Should you require physical training in the arts of war, you may speak with any of the instructors here for tutelage.

npcs.name: Kacha X'Rzheduis
utterances: Whatever.

npcs.name: K'Laus V'Derkn, the Shrewd
utterances: Welcome, this is the hall of the Dark Bargainers. We specialize in teleporters and other magical devices. Feel free to use our teleporters at the docks to leave the city. The power of the Sea Gate is quite phenomenal.

npcs.name: Laexae K'Oziana
utterances: Love and kindness are tools for the ignorant.

npcs.name: Lararra V'Zaar
utterances: I have nothing for you, outsider.

npcs.name: Lartana T'Tyhalyl
utterances: May the Dark Matron's blessing be with you.
May the dark bless your travels.
Ask me no questions and I'll tell you lies.

npcs.name: Lazarus D'Ryil, Hate's Fool
utterances: Don't you think this place is perfect? No threat of sunlight... Plenty of food.

npcs.name: Librarian Mervyn T'Xiett
utterances: Very good, Noeplil. Here, take a biscuit.
This is K'Lorn Library, here you may learn the arcane arts from our noble instructors.
Noeplil, take this note to Maxle poste haste!

npcs.name: Li'Neerala N'Zsitar
utterances: You are no challenge to this Berserker.  Begone.

npcs.name: Londiar Inygad
utterances: Hello there!  Would you perhaps be able to assist us with some Tinkering, Transmuting, or Adorning tasks?

Thank you, we are always in need of thingamajigs.  Please take this recipe and these components, and get to work.  You will need to supply your own fuel, however, and the cost of this will not be reimbursed.
Glad to hear it <player name>! Please take this recipe and these components, and get to work.  You will need to supply your own fuel, however, and the cost of this will not be reimbursed.
Good day, friend.  Let me know if you take up the craft of adorning, I may have some work for you if so.
That's great <player name>! Please take this recipe and these components, and get to work.  You will need to supply your own fuel, however, and the cost of this will not be reimbursed.
Fantastic, it should just take a moment to transmute these discarded guard boots?

npcs.name: Madam Gael
utterances: Your interest is noted, but you're not quite pretty enough to work for me.

npcs.name: Maerschel Calin T'Vor
utterances: We could make a real fighter out of you.

npcs.name: Magister De'Pater
utterances: Even the littlest of children must learn the lessons of Innoruuk, for they will be His future.

npcs.name: Maleyl D'Aleflor
utterances: Is it possible to love the Prince of Hate?

npcs.name: Malleus Incus
utterances: Sticks? Stones? Ha! Let me assure you, words hurt the most!
You are delaying my return to the master. And you can see what happens to those who upset her.

npcs.name: Malual K'Oziarn
utterances: This scroll is a holy relic. If it is to be moved it should go to the church, not the Queen. The Prophet of Hate demands it.
The Queen is no god. Innoruuk is, and the scroll is His.

npcs.name: Matteus Gaines
utterances: Leave me alone!
Thank you so much.

npcs.name: Maxle V'Xiafin
utterances: Get out of here! We don't serve your kind. Oh, a message from Mervyn, you say? Well, hand it over and then leave!

npcs.name: Merton V'Baenrae
utterances: A Scholar is rarely without demand for work.  I have a work order which we could use some help with. When you're ready to begin, just take the invoice from the work order clipboard or work order desk.

npcs.name: Minkacha K'Xiar
utterances: Oooooo!
Oooo!

npcs.name: Minxae Z'Melth
utterances: Get out of our city before you defile it further!

npcs.name: Misharu
utterances: Hello!  Such a mischievous day, is it not?

npcs.name: Moosk
utterances: The spirits call to each of us, but few of us can hear them.

npcs.name: Mur'ss Z'Hel'Viiryn
utterances: Ack!  You're befouling this place!

npcs.name: Myrafae D'Viath
utterances: I hope you put your affairs in order.

npcs.name: Nador V'Oziar
utterances: Ahh!

npcs.name: Naris T'Vaska
utterances: I'll gladly exchange some of my wares for some Defender's Medals.

npcs.name: The Narrator
utterances: And so it came to pass, just as it had been scribed long before:
"The Matron of Sealing who fashions all things has added matchless weapons, has born monster-serpents, sharp of tooth, and unsparing of cunning.
With venom for blood she has filled their bodies.  Meek twigs she has clothed with barbs.
Those who behold them are overcome by terror.
Their bodies rear up and none can withstand their attack."
When the world was still flat, and baked within light, and the creatures upon it went about their days with no aim...
Confusion reigned like the moon upon the land.
Matron and male, child and elder.  They tore at each other and walked different paths.  "This way!" "No that!"
And they knew nothing of purpose and ignored the power of hate.
There were many races then.
Ones of slight girth, treading upon the land.  Others like boulders leaving their mark.
Some crawled and dug out below, while others escaped with the air.
Our story is that of both below and above, of digging and flying.
The origin of Arasai.
Teir'Dal, with acts clandestine, set out to seize from the forest a blossom of fae.
A spirit of bone and potential ripe for the picking, rescued from tedium when born anew.
Blissful machinations awaited these pitiful blooms.

npcs.name: Nathffyn Do'Vinitar
utterances: Remember, not even death can stop the truth and power of Innoruuk's hate.

npcs.name: Neerral J'Zerath
utterances: May the dark bless your travels.
Ask me no questions and I'll tell you lies.
Glory to Neriak, City of Hate!

npcs.name: Neerssysn T'Zyzin
utterances: Do not tempt fate with your insolence.

npcs.name: Neervayas T'Vilyl
utterances: Glory to Neriak, City of Hate!
Better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
How can one not sing the praises of The Goddess and Queen, Cristanos?

npcs.name: Noeplil
utterances: You open now!
No, no. I have important things I must do! Bye-bye!
Open up!
I'm back! I gave note to the mean guy with the funny hat, just like you said!
Right away. Right away! I go now. I'm going. I'm... Bye!
My most honorifical master has told me to give you this note.
Open says me!

npcs.name: Nourdine Cazin
utterances: Don't let your illusions be shattered!

npcs.name: Old Salty
utterances: Bin fishin' this here lake fer ninety seven years, one day I'll catch me Snarling Jack.

npcs.name: Omarin T'Zaana
utterances: I'll gladly exchange some of my wares for some Defender's Medals.

npcs.name: Patellor Tibian
utterances: Mind your tongue while you've still got one!

npcs.name: Pellankiira S'Xemtor
utterances: I'm very busy. Unless you have business with the church please leave me be.

npcs.name: Phyravin D'Vaar
utterances: Not now. I need to see a man about an orc.
That's a joke, right? I mean, that must be what you charge the Haeth'Un. Surely you don't expect us to pay that amount... right?

npcs.name: Phyra Zesmice
utterances: Ohhh! Have you found what you are looking for?   I love shinies!
What shiny objects?  Why collections of course.  You'll find them spread all over Norrath.  Bring them back to me, and I'll make sure you are well rewarded.

npcs.name: Phyrriina Z'Tazival
utterances: What brings you to the Spires of Innoruuk, <player name>?

npcs.name: Pietre V'Noquett
utterances: Talk with Brixae.

npcs.name: Pudlonar
utterances: We feast... upon... the living... Come... closer.
...or else... it gets the hose again.

npcs.name: The Queen
utterances: Then be blessed to hear the fate that awaits the spirits you obtained.  Just as we gestated within Innoruuk's boiling hate, so will these beings be born and nourished by the hate that pounds within my breast.
These beings of mercy and pity will be made anew through violent cleansing.  Stripped of weakness and reformed in torture and destruction.
True, I may have been born into this world through my mother's womb, but it has ceased to constrain me.
And goddess.
You have done well for the future of the Teir'Dal empire.

npcs.name: Queen Cristanos
utterances: You would make a lovely eunuch.

npcs.name: Quevolg S'Torate
utterances: I have no use for someone of so few accomplishments.

npcs.name: Quilafein H'Tyhaduis
utterances: All these interruptions are driving me crazy! What now?
Yes? What is it you want to know?

You stand before the mighty Spires of Innoruuk. All praise the Dark Father! Here followers come to meditate and pray. The priests within commune with our Lord and give dark blessings to the deserving. Were you to require training in priestly matters, you most certainly would find assistance here.

npcs.name: Quilvyr Z'Setiiryn
utterances: The Indigo Brotherhood has long since demonstrated their obsolescence. Any halfwit can swing a sword. It's the one who can melt that sword with their mind who you must truly fear.
Once we decipher the true meaning behind the Runes of Hate, the Queen will have no choice but to adorn us with the highest of honors.

A member of the Ebon Mask is never to be trusted. They owe no real allegiance to the Queen or our father, Innoruuk. You there, check your pockets. I'm sure I just saw one of their larcenists skulking about behind you.

npcs.name: Rakshar Bucha
utterances: I never seen you before. Wonder what you would taste like. Mmmmmm!

npcs.name: Rauvryne B'Vaval
utterances: My, my!  Another warlock within our midst.  Do not worry; I do not consider you a threat.

If you find items that add to your intelligence or stamina, then take them!  Intelligence affects your spell focus and increases the damage your spells can cause.  Your stamina affects your health.  This is crucial.
We are masters of death and decay, inflicting poison and disease upon those that dare to challenge us, particularly on groups of opponents.
There are other adventuring classes that must rely on strong defenses to survive, but we focus on the offense.  No need to defend yourself from a foe who is writhing in pain, plagued with disease!

npcs.name: Rile D'Everhirr
utterances: Well, well, what have we here? Can I help you?

npcs.name: Sabisstra Z'Ziett
utterances: Better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
When the spider webs unite they can tie up any Haeth'Un.

npcs.name: Sacrym Ulnas
utterances: Who? What? No... No I'm sorry, I cannot help you.

npcs.name: Scapulus, the Muddled
utterances: Earth is one of the simplest elements to control. Hehe ...  How complicated can rocks be after all?
Oops! Heehee ... just shake it off, heehee ... Yes, yes... You're fine.
Water is a tricky element, but summoning water elements is easy enough, hee ... Watch.
Hmm, eh, something went wrong with that one... Odd.
Fire is a fun little element and useful, too. Watch this.
Oh, come on now, just stamp it out. You'll be fine.
Air is an interesting element. It's everywhere! Plus you can take control of all the energy in there and pull out this!
Oh, you're just a little singed. No harm, no foul.

npcs.name: Sharnar D'Zauer
utterances: A lack of resources has hanged many a person. Whether the Queen likes to admit it or not, access to the surface must be maintained. One cannot sustain oneself on mushrooms and lichen alone.
Let's see, if four bladders equals one stein and one goblet equals one fourth of a bladder then... Imoyn! That filching lout you call a brother has been skimming off the top again!
Certain... complications arose while the Ewer of Sul'Dae was being reconstructed. Some of the inhabitants that you speak with here may not be as they appear.
Opportunity for profit arises out of the ashes of destruction.

npcs.name: Sharor Y'Rzheate
utterances: Back away, if you know what's good for you.

npcs.name: Sornril V'Qherret
utterances: Trust no one more than yourself.
Glory to Neriak, City of Hate!

npcs.name: Spirdax D'Xavirr
utterances: You have entered Seloxia Stronghold, the home of the Indigo Brotherhood. You may find those who are willing to train you here.

npcs.name: Staria T'Martyl
utterances: Do return once your guild is more advanced.

npcs.name: Szinjss X'Vemtor
utterances: Hello, friend!  I'm here to teach interested people a little bit about how to harvest crafting materials, and how to craft tradeskilled items.  Are you interested?

Harvesting resources tend to be segregated by areas - for example, you'll be able to harvest items (often also called nodes) for making equipment for level 1-9 adventurers, in the same areas where you'll find level 1-9 adventurers hunting.  There are seven types of harvestable item:  wood, roots, ore, soft metal, animal dens, shrubs, and fish.  I'd like you to get a few harvests from each type of harvestable item.

npcs.name: Talace Z'Eilsath
utterances: Well, well <player name> what brings you here?

npcs.name: Talmur'ss V`Sek
utterances: Watch all about, warily, and Innoruuk may give you the gift of continued life.
Glory to Neriak, City of Hate!
Better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.

npcs.name: Tarven J'Oussana
utterances: Hmm?
Make it quick.

This place is Neriak Down Under. Within these halls you will find all manner of goods for sale, made by the finest tradesmen in all of Neriak. You may also find public facilities here to craft your own wares. Now if you'll excuse me, I'd like to continue stupefying myself on this ale.

npcs.name: Tazinid Z'Ret
utterances: May the Dark Matron's blessing be with you.
Trust no one more than yourself.

npcs.name: Tazroos B'Veett
utterances: Wow!
Ahh!

npcs.name: Tazvyll K'Zsirae
utterances: Ahh!

npcs.name: a Teir'Dal female
utterances: Revel in it.  It is all in glory of our Sacred Matron that we traverse within such vile lands as Faydark.
While the world still believes our empire to be buried or dead, it is our task to secret away fae spirits.  And we may just chance upon a few fated sacrifices along the way.

npcs.name: a Teir'Dal male
utterances: I am but your willing servant.  Your works are of great import!  You have brought order to the confusion that followed Innoruuk's absence.  We have come to thrive under your infallible leadership.
Upon this mortal realm, you alone hold the cunning, the power, the skill, and the hate to create such new beings from old.
To our fortune.
Glory to our queen.
Stabs of pain are what I feel being away from our cavernous capitol city.
You are without fault, Dark Lady.
My heart will flow with black delight in that!
We have returned to you, Baneful Queen, successful.

npcs.name: T'rissk X'Xylimtor
utterances: Glory to Neriak, City of Hate!
Ask me no questions and I'll tell you lies.
May the Dark Matron's blessing be with you.

npcs.name: T'Roveus M'Otal
utterances: Buying and selling is the name of the game.

npcs.name: Tsabrar De'Kenmtor
utterances: May the dark bless your travels.

npcs.name: T'varin K'valos
utterances: It harnesses the power of teleportation and allows us to keep our enemies at bay and our society here safe from harm. We can also use that power for other purposes such as personal teleportation.
I can send you as far as the Darklight Wood or you can use the teleportation pads all around the city to travel around the city at your leisure.
Off you go! Good luck!
The power of the Sea Gate is quite phenomenal. We can use it to channel teleportation magic!

npcs.name: Typhonus J'Nix
utterances: Welcome to The Nightsong Opera House.  Step in and enjoy our production of "Hate Gives Rise To Another Superior Race!"

npcs.name: Va'Idax K'Tyriep
utterances: Ack!  Let me continue my studies.

npcs.name: Viclin D'Rhivirr
utterances: We will not allow the removal of the scroll. It belongs here.
The magical properties of this scroll demand our involvement.

npcs.name: Vicna Te'Oris
utterances: Do you want to know your future? Just stare into my eyes and think of your question. Ready?
It is certain.

npcs.name: Vierae X`Lottl
utterances: May the Dark Matron's blessing be with you.
Ask me no questions and I'll tell you lies.
May the dark bless your travels.
Watch all about, warily, and Innoruuk may give you the gift of continued life.

npcs.name: Vier N'vul
utterances: Greetings <player name>!  How are you enjoying your crafting career?

I can help you change to another crafting profession, but you will have to forget everything you know, and start again as a low level artisan.  All the recipes specific to your class that you've learned so far will be forgotten.
Hold still, this won't hurt a bit.
I'm sorry, my services are only available to those more advanced in the arts.

npcs.name: Virun D'Xyafin
utterances: May you walk within his hate.

npcs.name: Vittia Direshadow
utterances: Please tell me you have something of importance to interrupt me with?

You wish to know my story? Very well, my life has been rich with the spoils of my family. However I find myself now on my own as I am to support my own spoils. I recently accompanied some of my kin into the Shard of Hate and found the experience both awe-inspiring as well as humbling.

The experience gave me the taste of battle and I find myself unable to be satisfied in my bloodlust. I now offer my services to anyone willing to drop me some coin and to fill the ever driving need to lock swords with anything that stands in my... I mean your way!

npcs.name: Vittoria D'Ryil
utterances: Members only, and you are far too fresh to be a member.

npcs.name: Vornd B'Texineld
utterances: There are only two types of Teir'Dal. Those who give bribes and those who take them.
It's best you conceal what you know rather than reveal what you don't. Might I suggest you keep silent?

npcs.name: Vuzyrd Do'Kenval
utterances: Leave this city before you are torn asunder within it!

npcs.name: Wehldril T'Vethilyl
utterances: I would watch my back if I were you.

npcs.name: Wodnar Z'Aleanzin, the Example
utterances: Ahhhh!

npcs.name: Wruznolu Z'Auv'Ryndar
utterances: Trust no one more than yourself.

npcs.name: Xilania Nevagon
utterances: When the time comes Hate will rise and crush the lesser orders of the gods.

npcs.name: X'Ta De'Xy'Lifor
utterances: You have not seen enough seasons to be of use, quite yet.

npcs.name: Xunica B'Rethiett
utterances: What brings you to the Spires of Innoruuk, <player name>?

npcs.name: Yann Graysmark
utterances: May your path be clear, friend.

npcs.name: Yasdra X'Zeraana
utterances: Ahh... Whoa!
Oooo!

npcs.name: Yazhiir H'Xel'Yll
utterances: Better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
When the spider webs unite they can tie up any Haeth'Un.

npcs.name: Zanotix Ixtaz
utterances: I will always be a slave to this forge.

npcs.name: Zarig T'Vaeliin
utterances: Nothing ventured, nothing gained!

npcs.name: Zezaghar D'Arkenth
utterances: What?

This place here is the Library of K'Lorn. Lots of information is held within the walls of this place. If you haven't already noticed, quite a few mages reside here as well. I've never been any good at the finger-waggling arts myself, but if you're looking for mage training, this is your place.

Parchment manufacturing. I collect the various roots that grow in the caves around Neriak and fashion root pulp into individual pages using a technique that's been handed down through the generations of my family. It's a lucrative profession if you have the patience. The mages can't get enough of them.

npcs.name: Zezas X'Zauzin
utterances: Hello.

npcs.name: Zezmyr D'Setirret
utterances: A Scholar is rarely without demand for work.  I have a work order which we could use some help with. When you're ready to begin, just take the invoice from the work order clipboard or work order desk.
